title: Provides for the provision of voter registration forms to students by colleges, universities and public high schools
summary: Provides for the provision of voter registration forms to students by colleges, universities and public high schools.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1228

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  BING,  KAVANAGH, REILLY, MILLMAN, SCHROEDER,
         BROOK-KRASNY, WRIGHT, JAFFEE, DINOWITZ,  ZEBROWSKI,  GABRYSZAK,  COOK,
         MAISEL,  SPANO, CASTRO, CAMARA -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BREN-
         NAN, GOTTFRIED, HEASTIE, JEFFRIES, McENENY,  PEOPLES-STOKES,  PHEFFER,
         N. RIVERA,  RUSSELL,  SWEENEY, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Election Law

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to voter registration  and
         enrollment

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 5-211 of the election law is amended  by  adding  a
    2  new subdivision 18 to read as follows:
    3    18. ALL COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOLS LOCATED IN THIS
    4  STATE  SHALL  MAKE  VOTER  REGISTRATION  FORMS AVAILABLE TO ANY ELIGIBLE
    5  STUDENTS IN THE SAME MANNER AND SUBJECT TO THE SAME PROVISIONS AND RULES
    6  AND REGULATIONS AS ALL OTHER DESIGNATED AGENCIES; EXCEPT THAT A COLLEGE,
    7  UNIVERSITY OR PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOL SHALL NOT BE  REQUIRED  TO  COLLECT  OR
    8  MAINTAIN  FORMS  CONTAINING  AN  INDIVIDUAL'S DECLINATION TO REGISTER TO
    9  VOTE AS REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION TEN OF THIS SECTION,  OR  TO  CONDUCT  A
   10  STUDY  AND  REPORT  THEREON AS REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION SEVENTEEN OF THIS
   11  SECTION.
   12    EACH COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY AND PUBLIC HIGH  SCHOOL  SHALL  PROVIDE  EACH
   13  ELIGIBLE  STUDENT  WITH A REGISTRATION FORM WITHIN THE FIRST THREE WEEKS
   14  OF SUCH STUDENT'S ENTRY TO SCHOOL  OR  ARRIVAL  ON  CAMPUS  PURSUANT  TO
   15  SUBDIVISIONS  TWO,  THREE,  FOUR,  FIVE, SEVEN, NINE, ELEVEN, TWELVE AND
   16  FIFTEEN OF THIS SECTION.  EVERY  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  AND  PUBLIC  HIGH
   17  SCHOOL  SHALL  DESIGNATE  AT LEAST ONE CONVENIENTLY LOCATED OFFICE WHERE
   18  STUDENTS MAY RECEIVE VOTER REGISTRATION FORMS AND PERSONAL ASSISTANCE IN
   19  THE COMPLETION OF SUCH FORMS. EACH SUCH OFFICE SHALL PUBLICIZE ITS VOTER
   20  REGISTRATION SERVICES PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF THIS SECTION, AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00647-02-1

       A. 1228                             2

    1  SHALL OFFER TO COLLECT AND TRANSMIT COMPLETED VOTER  REGISTRATION  FORMS
    2  FROM  STUDENTS  TO THE LOCAL BOARD OF ELECTIONS PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISIONS
    3  TWO, THREE, FIVE, NINE, ELEVEN, TWELVE AND FIFTEEN OF THIS SECTION.
    4    ANY COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OR SCHOOL DISTRICT MAY ELECT TO SOLICIT ONE OR
    5  MORE  RECOGNIZED  NON-PARTISAN  CAMPUS  BASED  ORGANIZATIONS  OR STUDENT
    6  GROUPS TO ASSIST IN ITS EFFORTS TO OFFER PERSONAL ASSISTANCE, COLLECTION
    7  AND TRANSMITTAL OF VOTER REGISTRATION FORMS.
    8    IN ADDITION TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF SUBDIVISIONS TWO, FIVE AND EIGHT OF
    9  THIS SECTION, ALL COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES OFFERING VOTER  REGISTRATION
   10  SERVICES SHALL INFORM STUDENTS OF THEIR RIGHT TO COMPLETE A VOTER REGIS-
   11  TRATION  FORM  FROM  THEIR  COLLEGE OR PREVIOUS ADDRESS; INFORM STUDENTS
   12  THAT THEIR DECISION TO REGISTER OR DECLINE TO  REGISTER  TO  VOTE  SHALL
   13  HAVE NO BEARING ON THEIR COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY RECORD; AND NOTWITHSTAND-
   14  ING  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  SUBDIVISION  NINE  OF  THIS SECTION, SHALL NOT
   15  INQUIRE OR KEEP RECORDS PERTAINING TO ANY STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY TO VOTE.
   16    IN ADDITION TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF THIS  SECTION,
   17  ALL  COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND SCHOOL DISTRICTS SHALL PLACE A PROMINENT
   18  LINK ON THEIR INTERNET HOMEPAGE TO THE APPROPRIATE PAGE OF THE  INTERNET
   19  WEBSITE  OF  THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS FOR INDIVIDUALS TO LEARN ABOUT
   20  THE QUALIFICATIONS TO VOTE, AND TO DOWNLOAD A VOTER  REGISTRATION  FORM,
   21  EXCEPT  THAT  FOR  COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK AND
   22  FOR THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK SUCH LINK SHALL  BE
   23  TO  THE  APPROPRIATE  PAGE  OF THE INTERNET WEBSITE OF THE NEW YORK CITY
   24  BOARD OF ELECTIONS.
   25    THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS AND, IN THE CITY OF  NEW  YORK,  THE  NEW
   26  YORK  CITY  BOARD  OF  ELECTIONS  SHALL OFFER COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND
   27  SCHOOL DISTRICTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO USE CODED VOTER REGISTRATION  APPLI-
   28  CATIONS THAT IDENTIFY EACH SUCH APPLICATION AS ORIGINATING FROM EITHER A
   29  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  OR PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOL. IF A COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OR
   30  SCHOOL DISTRICT ELECTS TO USE CODED VOTER REGISTRATION APPLICATIONS,  IT
   31  SHALL  BE  EXEMPT  FROM  ALL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION. THE
   32  STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS SHALL MAKE AVAILABLE AND PROVIDE FOR THE DELIV-
   33  ERY OF SUCH CODED APPLICATIONS TO  ANY  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  OR  SCHOOL
   34  DISTRICT WITHIN THE STATE WHICH SUBMITS A REQUEST THEREFOR.
   35    EVERY  BOARD  OF  ELECTIONS  SCANNING  VOTER  REGISTRATION FORMS SHALL
   36  CAPTURE ANY DESIGNATED AGENCY CODES THEREON AND REPORT THEM ON A MONTHLY
   37  BASIS TO THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS.
   38    S 2. The opening paragraph of section 5-211 of the  election  law,  as
   39  amended  by  chapter  200  of  the  laws  of 1996, is amended to read as
   40  follows:
   41    Each agency designated as a participating agency under the  provisions
   42  of  this  section,  AND  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY AND SCHOOL DISTRICT, shall
   43  implement and administer a program of distribution of voter registration
   44  forms pursuant to the provisions of this section. The following  offices
   45  which  provide  public  assistance  and/or provide state funded programs
   46  primarily engaged in providing services to persons with disabilities are
   47  hereby designated as voter registration agencies:    designated  as  the
   48  state  agencies  which  provide  public assistance are the department of
   49  [social services] FAMILY ASSISTANCE and the department of health.   Also
   50  designated  as  public  assistance  agencies  are  all agencies of local
   51  government that provide such assistance. Designated  as  state  agencies
   52  that  provide programs primarily engaged in providing services to people
   53  with disabilities are the department of labor,  office  for  the  aging,
   54  division  of veterans' affairs, office of mental health, office of voca-
   55  tional and  educational  services  for  individuals  with  disabilities,
   56  commission  on  quality  of  care  for the mentally disabled, office [of

       A. 1228                             3

    1  mental retardation and]  FOR  PEOPLE  WITH  developmental  disabilities,
    2  commission  for the blind and visually handicapped, office of alcoholism
    3  and substance abuse services, the office of the advocate for  the  disa-
    4  bled  and all offices which administer programs established or funded by
    5  such agencies. Additional state agencies designated as  voter  registra-
    6  tion  offices  are  the department of state and the division of workers'
    7  compensation. Such agencies shall be required to offer  voter  registra-
    8  tion  forms to persons upon initial application for services, renewal or
    9  recertification for services and change  of  address  relating  to  such
   10  services.  Such agencies shall also be responsible for providing assist-
   11  ance to applicants in completing voter registration forms, receiving and
   12  transmitting the completed application form from all applicants who wish
   13  to have such form transmitted to the appropriate board of elections. The
   14  state board of elections shall, together  with  representatives  of  the
   15  department  of  defense,  develop and implement procedures for including
   16  recruitment offices of the armed forces of the United  States  as  voter
   17  registration offices when such offices are so designated by federal law.
   18  The state board shall also make request of the United States Immigration
   19  and  Naturalization  Service to include applications for registration by
   20  mail with any materials which are given to new citizens.    [All  insti-
   21  tutions  of  the state university of New York and the city university of
   22  New York, shall, at the beginning of the school year, and again in Janu-
   23  ary of a year in which the president of  the  United  States  is  to  be
   24  elected, provide an application for registration to each student in each
   25  such  institution.]  The  state  board  of elections may, by regulation,
   26  grant a waiver from any or all of the requirements of  this  section  to
   27  any  office  or  program  of  an  agency,  COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OR SCHOOL
   28  DISTRICT, if it determines that it is not feasible for  such  office  or
   29  program to administer such requirement.
   30    S  3.  The  opening paragraph of subdivision 8 of section 5-211 of the
   31  election law, as amended by chapter 659 of the laws of 1994, is  amended
   32  to read as follows:
   33    Each  participating  agency, department, division or office that makes
   34  available voter registration forms pursuant to this section shall  offer
   35  with  each  application  for  the services or assistance of such agency,
   36  department, division or office and with each recertification, renewal or
   37  change of address form relating to such service or assistance, a  regis-
   38  tration  form  together  with  instructions  relating  to eligibility to
   39  register and for completing the form, except that COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES
   40  AND SCHOOL  DISTRICTS  SHALL  DISTRIBUTE  VOTER  REGISTRATION  FORMS  IN
   41  ACCORDANCE  WITH SUBDIVISION EIGHTEEN OF THIS SECTION, AND forms used by
   42  the department of [social services] FAMILY ASSISTANCE  for  the  initial
   43  application  for  services,  renewal or recertification for services and
   44  change of address relating to such services shall physically incorporate
   45  a voter registration application in a fashion  that  permits  the  voter
   46  registration  portion  of the agency form to be detached therefrom. Such
   47  voter registration application shall be designed so  as  to  ensure  the
   48  confidentiality  of  the  source  of the application.   Included on each
   49  participating agency's application for services or assistance  or  on  a
   50  separate form shall be:
   51    S  4.  Paragraph (g) of subdivision 5 of section 5-210 of the election
   52  law, as amended by chapter 179 of the laws of 2005, is amended  to  read
   53  as follows:
   54    (g)  Notice that the applicant must be a citizen of the United States,
   55  is [or will be at least eighteen years old not later than December thir-
   56  ty-first of the calendar year in which he or  she  registers]  AT  LEAST

       A. 1228                             4

    1  SEVENTEEN YEARS OLD WHEN HE OR SHE SUBMITS AN APPLICATION TO REGISTER TO
    2  VOTE and a resident of the county or city to which application is made.
    3    S  5. This act shall take effect July 1, 2011; provided, however, that
    4  the provisions of this act shall only apply to school districts  on  and
    5  after July 1, 2012.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to voter registration and enrollment
